ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved upon my Spanish a lot.
I learned how to communicate in different tenses in Spanish while immersing myself in different Latinx cultures.
This class deepened my knowledge of the Spanish language an extraordinary amount.
I learned how to speak Spanish without having to memorize a sentence.
I built my spanish grammar and vocabulary immensely while also becoming more comfortable speaking and writing.
I learned how to readily engage in conversations with spanish-speaking people.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: VHL was really helpful and I also really enjoyed the Linguameetings to practice

I liked the in class compositions. I think the cultural projects were a great asset in improving my oral skills. I think the course should have weekly mini quizzes on individual lessons to make sure that students understand certain topics rather than one big quiz spanning across multiple lessons.
This course has many strengths including linguameeting. There are no weaknesses.
Weaknesses were the projects. They weren't engaging, and were more busy work than anything. The strengths were the partnering/grouping up and discussing grammar, vocabulary, etc.
Very well structured in class with plenty of opportunity to practice speaking and review grammar we learn on VHL. A lot of cultural immersion in various forms.
Some assignments felt unnecessary / busywork, some of SuperSite was not useful but some was so I wouldn't take it all out

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I definitely would. Its not very time consuming but you still get a lot from the class. Professor Reymundi is also incredible.
Yes, if they want to actually start learning Spanish in a meaningful way.
Yes, it's an easy language to learn, very similar to english.
Yeah, if necessary for world language requirement. I would not recommend it as a "fun" class to take
Of course. While you're required to, it is a fun course in which you can feel and see yourself improving.
